page.title: 11The Church and its people
page.content: In 1854 there were 300 parishioners and few visitors. In 1985 there are 30 parishioners and thousands of visitors. The congregation consists mainly of islanders and the church can seat approximately 85. On average about 5 or 6 attend together with some visitors. The Scouts and Guides make visits to the island and in June 1985 Lady Baden-Powell visited it to celebrate 75 years of Guides. {Renovations.}The people contribute to the church fund which at present is funding the renovation of the church roof because the ornamental pins which hold the roof up are rusting away. After 34 years of being closed to the public the National Trust bought the island and in 1963 re-opened it. Since then the church has enjoyed more recognition and many visitors.
